thread.title: State Report: College of Charleston equestrian team captures reserve championship
thread.title_full: State Report: College of Charleston equestrian team captures reserve championship

title: State Report: College of Charleston equestrian team captures reserve championship
text: State Report: College of Charleston equestrian team captures reserve championship Staff reports Oct 20 2015 12:27 am × The College of Charleston equestrian team rode to a reserve championship in a two-day competition hosted by the USC Equestrian Club at Three Fox Farm in Blythewood over the weekend; the team finished fourth on the first day. Blaine Ferraro (open flat), Jackie Lundsted (novice fences, 4-C) and Rachel Megdal (novice flat, 3-D) claimed wins in their respective classes on the opening day of competition while Hannah Showell (intermediate flat, sec. A), Mia Vawter (novice fences, sec. A) and Taylor Bibbiani (advanced WTC, sec. D) took home victories on day two. High school tennis Porter-Gaud’s first-round match in the SCISA Class AAA girls tennis state playoffs against Wilson Hall has been rescheduled to Tuesday at 4 p.m. in Sumter. Porter-Gaud, the third seed in the upper bracket, is the defending state champion. Wilson Hall is the second seed in the bracket. Golf The Citadel women’s golf team is currently in 11th place after one round of competition at the Terrier Intercollegiate in Spartanburg. Marina Grimal and Cameron Little are both tied for 33rd after 18 holes at The Country Club of Spartanburg. Renata Sucha is tied for 50th after carding an 88 on the day. Laura Simpson shot a 105 to put her in 57th overall. The tournament resumes Tuesday with round two beginning at 9:30 a.m. with a shotgun start. Keywords
